results.title: [ESI]Assersion: dyn_cast on a non-existent value
results.notes: CLOSED issue with exact same error message pattern 'dyn_cast on a non-existent value'. Different subsystem (ESI) but same root cause pattern of unsafe dyn_cast on potentially null/non-existent values.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Unpacked array causes crash
results.notes: CLOSED issue - MooreToCore conversion crash with unpacked arrays. Similar domain (MooreToCore, unpacked arrays) but CLOSED. Likely related to port conversion issues.

results.title: [PrepareForEmission] Crash when inout operations are passed to instance ports
results.notes: OPEN issue - InOutType assertion failure during port processing. Different phase (PrepareForEmission vs MooreToCore) but same underlying issue: unsafe port type handling with InOutType.

results.title: [MooreToCore] Support for UnpackedArrayType emission
results.notes: OPEN feature request - UnpackedArrayType emission in MooreToCore. Directly related to our crash (unpacked arrays of strings as ports). This is an enhancement tracking the exact feature needed to fix the crash.

results.title: [MooreToCore] OOB array slices of unpacked arrays lowered like packed arrays
results.notes: OPEN issue - Unpacked array handling in MooreToCore. Related to the same subsystem and type handling issues.

analysis: The crash signature 'dyn_cast on a non-existent value' matches issue #8219 exactly. However, that issue is CLOSED and in a different subsystem (ESI). The current crash occurs in MooreToCore/PortImplementation.h, and the root cause is unpacked array of strings not being properly handled during port conversion, yielding a null type. While #8219 has the same error message, it's in a different context. Issue #8276 is the most relevant OPEN issue as it directly addresses the missing UnpackedArrayType support in MooreToCore. The current crash is likely a variant or duplicate of #8276's scope. Recommendation: Review #8276 and consider this a related bug in the same feature gap.
